page.title: 02The Tame Valley
page.content: From Haughton Dale House 1713 a path crosses the valley floor.Just beyond ARDEN BRIDGE is a small picnic area and a weir which once fed water to Arden Mill.The rapids below the weir show the power of the river which has formed a steep sided valley. On the near side of the river, a boulder lies in the water.Legend has it that Robin Hood threw it from the top of Werneth Low, two miles away.Soon you are in Hulme's Wood.This scenic oak, beech and sycamore woodland covers one of the old secrets of Denton-it was once one of Lancashire's major coal mining areas,and the wood grows on old spoil heaps.The wood is an area set aside for nature study and offers a flavour of history,people,industries and natural features which have helped to shape the area. .
